column4: I've just tried moving up to flash 9 beta, but about:plugins in firefox still says I have version 7 installed. I put libplashplayer.so in /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox/plugins
Not everyone has root permission, it's more natural to put it under your .mozilla/plugins/
that's where is was before, and should work from there for all users, no?
And make sure the flash 7 plugin is uninstalled, this sometimes cause problem.
yeah did that
Yes, but if you're the only user in the system, it makes more sense to put it in your home folder.
not the only user
If you insist, try putting it in /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/, this is not guaranteed to work though.
The difference is that we never know what the binary flash 7 package did to our system without a monitor.
huh? the install script is quite simple.
Ahh, I forgot there's a downloadable package, of course. You may put it under /usr/lib/firefox/plugins/ to see if it works, I'd recommend to work within your home though.
put it in home as well, but now about:plugins shows both 9 and 7 installed. I can't work out where version 7 is coming from. Is there a search path for firefox plugins somwhere/
What did you install flash 7 with ?.
flashplugin-nonfree package. But have uninstalled that now. AFAIK it just downloads the plugin, extracts it into the plugins directory
is 'ls -la /usr/lib/mozilla-firefox' shows that a symlink ?
to /usr/lib/firefox ?
yep

Does '/usr/lib/firefox/plugins/' contain a copy of flash 7 ? I guess it doesn't though, either way, try removing the plugin in your home dir first then accessing a flash site to see if Fx works normally.
it has a copy of flash 9. Will try removing it from there to see if firefox still thinks it has flash 7
go on, you may delete both of them (/usr/lib and ~/.mozilla), perhaps firefox went crazy after the installation.
just got rid of the one in /usr/lib, and it no longer thinks it has flash 7.
That's sort of the problem, if you have flash 7 installed via aptitude and put flash 9 plugin in your home, /sometimes/ firefox insists on running the 7 version, that's weird but a minor issue.
now I got rid of it from ~/.mozilla, and put it back in /usr/lib, and firefox tells me I'm running version 7 again. Wierd
It's likely to be some orphan configuration stays put after flash 7 removal, another good idea to mess with your own home directory rather than root's btw. ;)
